subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Women Peranakan costumes Children
physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady and a child. Both of them are sitting down, with the child sitting on a miniature chair on the left hand side of the photograph. Both of them are dressed in their ethnic costumes and they are looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a nyonya seated beside a child. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Studio portrait of a seated nyonya with child
